title.narrative: Improving West-African Capacities in Mediation and Peace Process

description.narrative: The Continental Capacity Building Project aims to address limited mediation capacities of African regional and sub-regional actors/institutions to respond to serious conflict situations. This will be achieved by strengthening institutions and developing th e capacity of individuals in conflict analysis dialogue and mediation to improve peace processes in sub-Saharan Africa. Actual activities of the project include the conduction of training programmes on conflict analysis and multi-track peace mediation expe rience sharing workshops thematic expert seminars the production of training films as well as documentary publications on conflict analysis dialogue and mediation processes in the region. Furthermore the project will contribute to the analysis on the them atic subject of gender-based violence. The project will also aim to the strengthen formal and informal working relationships with institutions in West Central and East Africa such as ECOWAS ECCAS UNOWA UNOCA IGAD. Strengthening these relations will help CM I identify and frame responses to capacity development needs of these sub-regional actors regarding broad areas of conflict prevention peace building and mediation as well as further raise CMI's profile on the continent and beyond.
